events.event_name: S&P Global Brazil Composite PMI Release (January 2026)
events.description: The release of the composite purchasing managers' index for Brazil's private sector for January 2026.

facts.fact_text: The S&P Global Brazil Composite PMI fell to 49.9 in January 2026 from 52.1 in December.

evidences.evidence_text: The S&P Global Brazil Composite PMI fell to 49.9 in January 2026 from 52.1 in December

facts.fact_text: Employment in the Brazil private sector declined for the first time in three months.

evidences.evidence_text: employment declined for the first time in three months, with modest job losses across both services and industry.

facts.fact_text: Input costs and output prices in Brazil rose at the fastest pace in two months.

evidences.evidence_text: input costs and output prices rose at the fastest pace in two months.

claims.claim_text: Brazil's private-sector activity is broadly stagnant at the start of 2026.
claims.author: S&P Global

evidences.evidence_text: signaling broadly stagnant private-sector activity at the start of the year.

claims.claim_text: Services growth was insufficient to compensate for the contraction in manufacturing.

evidences.evidence_text: While services output continued to expand, growth slowed sharply and failed to offset a deeper contraction in manufacturing production.

evidence.evidence_text: The S&P Global Brazil Composite PMI fell to 49.9... signaling broadly stagnant private-sector activity
employment declined for the first time in three months
input costs and output prices rose at the fastest pace in two months.
